name: Pardon My French
address: 103 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA

reviews.text: Delicious food and great service!
Amazing service & good! My fav neighborhood spot!
good food, but the service stands out.
One of my favorite spots in the neighborhood! Consistent food and unbeatable ambiance.  There's even a backyard. I can't recommend enough!
Another amazing meal at PMF! The atmosphere, food, and wine is exceptional. You really feel like you‚Äôre in France.
Great food, good wine and cocktail selection and very friendly waiter - highly recommend this place, will definitely come back!
An amazing casual French dining experience!
Ava is absolutely amazing - couldn‚Äôt recommend her more & the drinks are to die for
Wonderful service-worthy of a Michelin
Ava and Robby were awesome!
love Ava!
Ava was amazing
Fantastic food and service!
Eli was great, food was fantastic and the cocktails were superbe - super chouette!
I had Duck Confit and a Chocolate Mousse.It was a wonderful experience!
My favorite spot on the East side. Great food, great staff, great vibes.

We love the staff, in particular, of this local watering hole. The cocktails, food, atmosphere, and little garden are all great, but the servers are warm and friendly and it‚Äôs been a pleasure to get to know them!
It was a lovely atmosphere and food!
Great everything!
Had the chicken sandwich and eggs benedict for brunch, it was delicious! Waiter was cool and nonchalant.
our brunch staple. so delicious, great service, great ambiance
Cocktails were great, goat cheese salad was well dressed. My cod was undercooked and my friend‚Äôs salmon was overcooked. Service and atmosphere was good.
Amazing service, atmosphere, food and drinks !  John took really good care of us and I‚Äôll definitely be coming back:)
Love this place ‚ù§Ô∏è
Great food, atmosphere, and service. Pardon My French is one of the best restaurants in the East Village
The food was really good, but they were out of espresso and avocado toast when we got there. Overall, it was still a great experience
Great food and vibe!! Can‚Äôt wait to come back! Jean  was amazing!

Mi favorito lugar desde hace m√°s de 10 a√±os!
El servicio, la calidad de su comida, y el ambience me hacen regress at siempre, los huevos Benedictos üôåüèº

Zoe and Evan were such great bartenders. They were so nice and made sure to make our drinks perfect/just the way we like it. I highly recommend this place and the wonderful atmosphere from the people that work there
Nothing special. Great mimosas deal
I don't even usually love omelettes, but I just had the best omelette of my life paired with arguably the best French toast I've eaten in my life. Full stop.
Their sauces are absolutely incredible.
Perfect French eatery ! Friendly staff and cozy garden seating.
Just fine
As long as you don't come here expecting a quiet affair, you'll have a blast. Reasonable prices, fun service, Pardon My French is a hoot.
Amazing service, best waiters I‚Äôve ever encountered. Bottomless brunch is the best deal in the city.

It was bringing a welcomed retro style when I stepped inside. The food was great, I loved my Duck Confit with Spinach - I ate it clean üòÜ.
The only thing that I wished was my espresso martini had more alcohol. This place is perfect for either singles or groups. A reservation is recommended as it's usually packed up.
I heard that there is a garden sitting as well, and I will come back to check it out when the weather is nicer.
great food, nice atmosphere, helpful staff. liked the back patio. they are no longer cash only! you can pay digitally or with credit card

Amazing French vibes! Super cozy. Great service. Escargot was great and the NY strip was delicious.
Great indoor and outdoor seating options.
Ava and Zoe are the best ! Please come here if you want to have a great time!
Everything from start to finish was five star. Place had a lively atmosphere and everything that we ordered was definitely French inspired.
Great spot. Vibes, food, service and pricing were all great! Steak tartare was fantastic. Steak frites and salad with egg were also great
Fantasy food! Great small place.

We had such a lovely moment! ‚ú® All the dishes were delicious, such a cool vibes , all the waiters were very nice and kind and Jean who took care of us was amazing ! ‚ú® I truly recommend this place ! ‚ú®
It was wonderful-as always!!
The service was impeccable, big shoutout to Jean!
Jean made our experience really really fun - thank you!!!
Francesca‚Äôs playlist is phenomenal, pure JOYYYYY  ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
Great place for a bottomless birthday brunch!
Eli was an amazing server & made my friend‚Äôs birthday so special! The food was amazing!!
ÌîÑÎ†åÏπòÌÜ†Ïä§Ìä∏Í∞Ä ÏµúÍ≥†! ÏãúÎÅåÏãúÎÅå Ìù•Í≤®Ïö¥ Î∂ÑÏúÑÍ∏∞Î•º ÏõêÌïúÎã§Î©¥ Í≥†Í≥†!

Came for dinner and sat on the patio in the back. Inside was way too loud for my taste.

Overall, food was amazing. The bone marrow and escargots were fantastic, and the mussels (mustard sauce) were phenomenal. I highly recommend all three of those.

The steak was not worth ordering. It came sliced, which I don‚Äôt prefer. It also was overcooked (I ordered it medium rare but came medium well).

In terms of the service‚Ä¶ food was very slow to come out. There were several severs running food, refilling waters, etc. which was lovely.

While the steak was disappointing, I would come back to order the other items again. I think I‚Äôd sit at the bar next time.

Came here for a boozy brunch on Sunday and joined the many others that were there for the same. It‚Äôs a fun vibe and the food is pretty good for brunch food. Service can be a bit patchy but they try their best. Loved the old school atmosphere of the space.

Great spot for brunch, waitstaff are super friendly and speed of food & service is excellent! The Turkish eggs are to die for, generous portions and mimosas/bloody marys were flowing without needing to ask. What more could you want for a Sunday brunch. I would definitely advise pre-booking to guarantee a table, those without a reservation had a long wait time.

This place definitely has a vibe. Located in the East Village, it maintains a neighborhood feel. The interior looks good but needs a little touch-up with decor. The French cuisine offers a good variety of different signature French dishes. I recommend the escargot and octopus carpaccio as appetizers. For the entr√©e, I ordered branzino. It was good, but it had a light fish taste, which I personally don‚Äôt like (based on my experience, well-cooked fish usually doesn‚Äôt taste too fishy). Meanwhile, the mussels were made great. I‚Äôm not a big fan of them, but they are cooked very well at this place. To sum up, it‚Äôs recommended for an old-vibe New York dining experience.

I thought this would be a generic over priced fancy restaurant but I was wrong. The food is delicious and better than what I was expecting. The La Burrata was great and cr√®me br√ªl√©e were made perfectly imo. The staff was very nice and welcoming to. Only gave it 4 stars because the lighting was pretty low for me and place was kind of packed

Lovely restaurant with a nice back garden. Good selection of wine. The steak was cooked well. So were the fries. We tried both the original and the truffle fries and they were both good but I preferred the texture of the truffle ones‚Ä¶

This is the cutest little brunch spot with the kindest and most amazing, vibrant, and hospitable staff! We went to celebrate my best friend‚Äôs bridal shower and the bottomless brunch (bottomless mimosas that are poured frequently with your choice of entrees from a wide selection of items) was impressively priced at $41 especially for NYC! The host/server we had (I wish I got their name because they *made* our experience) was a true ray of sunshine and such a sweetheart and our table of 8 girls had a thoroughly fantastic time. The only reason I withheld a star was 1) it‚Äôs cash only and you may not know that off the bat, which is a bit frustrating 2) it was a muggy day and there didn‚Äôt appear to be air conditioning at the premises- it was a bit muggy and humid. Otherwise, it was a lovely time- the food isn‚Äôt to die for but it was still delicious for the price especially!

This is a great brunch spot. They have a bottomless mimosa or Bloody Mary option along with an entree for $40. The Bloody Mary was good, spicy enough. The croque madame was very tasty; the pancakes were all right. Only downside about this place is it‚Äôs cash only. But they do seem to have an outdoor terrace at the back which would be so nice in spring!

Went for boozy free flow brunch. Definitely great value at $39.
The food was average on the cusp of being good. Service wasn‚Äôt the best to me, however the most annoying thing is that they are cash only. So be cautious of that.

My friend and I had a great evening here recently. We‚Äôd both been at this restaurant a lot years ago when it was Casimir, and it still has the same cozy ambience and great bistro food. We started with the Ch√®vre Chavignolles salad; it came with perfectly toasted rounds of goat cheese and nicely dressed mixed greens. The wine list is good and uncomplicated ‚Äì you can spend not too much and still have a very nice glass of wine.  You can also spend a lot. We kept things simple and had the C√¥te du Rh√¥ne and Pinot Noir with Coq au Vin and Cod en Papillotte, both delicious. The only disappointment was the Tarte Tatin, which didn‚Äôt live up to the rest of the meal: an individually baked serving on a cracker-like crust with a dollop of ice cream. That said, I‚Äôll happily return: a fun bistro with friendly efficient staff, delicious food, and great atmosphere.

Their bottomless brunch option with mimosa/Bloody Mary is a great deal. By the way, you can switch from mimosa to Bloody Mary (or vice versa) during the course of your meal.
Really liked the Tunisian eggs and French toast. My friends liked the escargot as well.

**Note: this place is cash-only!

Amazing bottomless mimosa experience. The service was great - we did make a reservation, but even though it was a busy Saturday we were seated quickly. Our drinks were served first, and we only had to wait maybe 15 minutes before our food came out. The food itself was fantastic, tasted very delicious. I had the Eggs Scandinavian, my partner got the Tunisian Eggs. My partner's only complaint was that it felt light, so if you want a fuller brunch I'd recommend getting a third dish to split if you're with someone. (It was enough for me but I was also full of mimosas.)
Very cute and beautiful garden! Everyone was really nice. The food was so good too but not amazing. But I had a very nice time.

Any place I come back for a second time means it‚Äôs worth my time. Beautiful calming atmosphere. good food. Last time I was here I had the best French Toast I‚Äôve ever had in my life. This time it was all but mediocre unfortunately. Everything was fine, nothing wrong - just not exceptional; hence, the 4 stars. Thank you for having us.

Great food!
They have set brunch, with either coffee or bloody marry. There is a variety of food to choose from, and all the ones we ordered were good!
The French roasts came with fresh fruits, and the one without Nutella tasted better in my opinion, as it was not overly-sweet. The Benedict was good, with nice salad dressing. The baked potatoes were also very flavorful.
Portion was huge, and sharing is better if you cannot eat a lot. Great and polite service!

I loved this restaurant. It‚Äôs now my one of my top spots for brunches! They hosted my birthday party for 13 people and we all had a great time! Everyone loved the place and service and I really want to thank every one here for making things perfect. The bottomless mimosas, the Scandinavian eggs , Tunisian eggs and avocado toast our our favorites!!! Recommend everyone to visit this place. Thanks again!

I‚Äôd say a toast if my mouth wasn‚Äôt full of one already

One of the east brunch spots and best French toast spots around the city is definitely @pmf_nyc ! A giant slice of brioche covered in Nutella, berries, and powdered sugar. Is it breakfast or dessert? Pair it with bottomless mimosas and you have the excuse to call it brunch!

Anyone else find it funny that the dish is called French toast though? Anyone know where the name came from? Just like French fries aren‚Äôt really French, this dish isn‚Äôt exactly either. The first time this name was given was by the English! Although the French do have a similar dish called pain perdu, meaning lost bread. Pain perdu was made from stale bread that would‚Äôve otherwise been tossed out. Today, most restaurants use nicer fluffy breads like brioche or challah

Catch ya on the flip side, NY
They have so many great brunch options like these flipping fantastic pancakes stacked high with fruit and whipped cream, and brioche French toast with Nutella and fruit. They even bottomless options - coffee, tea, mimosas, bloodies. They have some savory food options too, but you know me, I‚Äôve got a big sweet tooth!

Lovely decor and wonderful frenchly accented service to go with. The escargot was exceptional, the duck was delicious, and both desserts shared were simply decadent. Looking forward to seeing how their brunch and cheese selection compares‚Ä¶

Went for my wife's birthday brunch and PMF did not disappoint. The staff was so nice and attentive. I love the decor and it was not like some of the city boozy bottomless brunches that can get really loud and sloppy. The food was delicious and came out pretty quickly. I love the pancakes and was absolutely stuffed after.

I love the decor of flowers everywhere, although the loud music blasting is odd for lunchtime. The service was good and everyone was really nice and attentive and accomodating. I had steak and they cooked it perfectly for medium rare. It‚Ä¶
Jean was our server. He was extremely attentive, thoughtful, and kind. We ordered the French toast, Tunisian eggs, and eggs Benedict, and all were very good!

Sat at the bar. Barely had any service from the bartender. Wanted to ask for cocktail recommendations and the bartender was very impatient, and even worse, it's not because he was busy serving other customers since the night was not too busy.

Food was okay and nothing really stands out. Tapas style food so you can order and share a lot of stuff. Won't come again.

Walk-ins okay on weekdays nights.

Really, really enjoyed my experience here. Walked in with high expectations, and walked away with an even higher heart.

We sat in the garden, and the ambiance was very relaxing. The meal started out with baguettes (obviously) and butter. The butter had a tint of garlic in it, which dramatically enhanced the combined taste of the bread.

I first ate the bone marrow, and dare I say it's probably the best bone marrow I've ever had. It's incredibly succulent, and the additional seasoning augmented the natural taste of the marrow. It melted in my mouth, and anything left in the actual bone was quickly scooped up by the bread that came along with it.

I also ate the daily special, which was a rack of lamb. Overall, it was a very solid piece of meat, not too rare, and not too dry. It came with vegetables (also very good and crunchy) and potato souffl√©. The souffl√© was very creamy and and an excellent addition to the meal.

Overall, it was a very good meal. Service was excellent as they attended to out every need and was very prompt about it.

Excellent food with excellent service; what more could you ask for?
Great spot for dinner, especially large group. Service was excellent. Everything we ordered was very delicious. Merci :)

Great atmosphere, vintage signs all over the garden. Indoors very beautiful. Service was great. Attentive and prompt. Good times were had by all who came here in this French bistro just off Tomkin's Square Park...

Steak au poivre and burrata with tomato and deviled eggs so good. Definitely want to come back to the garden backyard with some puppy friends one day too

Loved this East Village spot!
Visited with a bunch of friends for Saturday brunch and was not disappointed!
From the croque madame, through Scandinavian and Tunisian Eggs (spicy shakshuka style) to bottomless mimosas / bloody marys - everything was delicious and looked great as well! Gonna become a go - to for NY brunch!

Pardon my review. So, I feel like the biggest draw to this place is the "perceived" value; however, you get there and the truth quickly reveals itself. I don't mind cost cuts if the guest doesn't know/feel the difference,  but here, you feel it every step of the way. You dine in a HOT unairconditioned hallway with wobbly wooden tables long past due for retirement. Unfiltered tap water to drink. NO CREDIT CARDS ACCEPTED; CASH ONLY. Prosecco mimosas made with mostly OJ. Greens as side but when asked for potatoes instead they said it would be a $10 upcharge, even though potatoes are less food cost than greens and you get about 1/2 cup total. Undercooked egg whites on croque madame, no Mornay sauce, and VERY poor quality eggs. Website advertises that the entire staff speaks french, but the spanish speaking backserver was confused and non-responsive when addressed in French. Spend $20 more overall at a different brunch place of your choice and get double the bang for your buck! Not reccomended!! Would NOT go back.

Great food but abysmal service...

To start things off, I had a brunch reservation set for 1pm but our table wasn't ready until 40 minutes later. We were initially seated inside and then the hostess came and said our table was actually outside instead. When we sat down at the outdoor table we were disappointed to find holes in the table and leftover food and drinks from the previous customers that took even more time to get cleaned up.

**this place is also cash only, which I've never heard of for a brunch spot. They didn't say that anywhere on their website so we had to spend even more time finding an atm....

It was so hot and humid outside and the outdoor area didn't have enough umbrellas, so it was a pretty rough experience until we got our mimosas which also took an egregiously long time. My friends purse got stuck in the table we were sitting at and the chain broke cause we had to yank it out. It would be nice if they get some better tables outside.

I will say the quality of the food is better than most brunch places I've been to. I'd personally recommend the Nutella French toast

Warm and welcoming interior and delicious brunch! The brussel sprouts were so amazing we decided to order another one, but the second plate was overcooked and soggy as opposed to the perfectly cooked first plate. Disappinting in that regards,  but i hope it doesn't happen often. Bottomless mimosas was also nice.

Layout/atmosphere
*French bistro/restaurant; bar area and few tables in front; most of the tables/booths in back; candle lit; exposed brick walls; backyard area

Service
*Excellent

Food/drink
*Lobster bisque (appetizer special) - very good; creamy, buttery; got a few small chunks of lobster meat
*PMF Burger (Wagyu Beef, Gruy√®re, Lettuce, Tomato, Red Onion, house made sauce on sesame brioche bun) with French fries - really good; patty was juicy; vegetables were fresh/nice crunch; fries were crispy
*Complimentary bread & butter - sourdough esque
*Paper Plane cocktail (Yellowstone Bourbon, Aperol, Lemon, Amaro Nonino) - Good; sweet

Great place for a boozy brunch but be aware that this option is one main dish and unlimited mimosa $41 CASH ONLY! I went there with a big group of friends and they constantly brought us jars of mimosas. I have the EGGS BENEDICT and it tasted very good, they come with some potatoes and salad. The staff is very kind and attentive. Fully recommended!

ESPA√ëOL:
Restaurante genial para brunch con bebidas ilimitadas pero ten en cuenta que esta opci√≥n incluye un plato y mimosas ilimitadas por $41 SOLO EFECTIVO! Fui con un gran grupo de amigos y nos trajeron jarras de mimosas constantemente. Tom√© los EGGS BENEDICT y estaban muy buenos, vienen con patatas y ensalada. El personal es amable y atento. Totalmente recomendado!

it is on the pricier side and cash only but i really enjoyed it. the food was really good i will say though the portions aren‚Äôt the biggest and for brunch, you need to do either bottomless or get a coffee/tea with the entree. they offered plant based milks with the coffee at no additional charge!!

Amazing ambiance & food & drinks & service!
Even the butter that comes with bread tastes like heaven. I haven't had burger this tasty since Au Chevel closed. Their truffle fries genuinely tasted like‚Ä¶

Notes: CASH-ONLY $$$

Food + Price
We reserved ahead for a table of 9 for brunch for 1pm on Saturday. Brunch is a prix-fix of $39 for bottomless mimosas, and $26 w/o alcohol. The establishment has all of your brunch staples, eggs benny, pancakes, avocado toast, etc.

I opted to not get breakfast so late into the afternoon and ordered the Moules-frites $24 (mussels and french fries). Sizable mussels, no grit, and perfect garlic flavor. Only wish I had some bread to dip into the pot to absorb all the soup. Fries were perfectly crispy and satisfying.

A lot of friends ordered the eggs benny, they cleaned their plates. The burgers were cooked to perfection and huge (they come with fries even though it doesn't say on the menu)

Vibes + Wait Staff
Its a beautiful place and has outdoor patio seating which would be great if it was warmer. Loved the bar upfront to chill and wait for you table before being seated. Unfortunately but understandably, b/c its so popular and busy expect a little longer wait times here and there and do not expect to be able to idle around to chit chat. The waiters need to prep for the next customers so after the bill is paid expect to skidaddle out. Apart from that, the staff were attentive, polite and super efficient.

Only one unisex bathroom available (no hooks inside to hang ur bag or jackets ladies)

Lovely, lively, and fun Birthday Brunch on the patio! We had a reservation for one PM and were sat immediately. Wonderful service. Ordered: Egg‚Äôs Benedict- was good- eggs perfectly poached. Steak Frites- crispy fries & steak was cooked as ordered, med-rare and tasty. Tunisian eggs was good- probably wouldn‚Äôt order again‚Ä¶.but enjoyed something different. Waitress was lovely & attentive. Ordered Bottomless mimosas & Bloody Marys- not very boozy but we enjoyed them. This is not the place for a ‚Äòcheap boozy brunch‚Äô - the bottomless brunch limits you to the front of the menu items‚Ä¶ so be aware before you go. Inside was very loud so we were happy to be on patio, which I had requested at time of reservation; it‚Äôs adorable and more quiet but still fun. Came here for my birthday brunch and it was a great spot! The service was very nice and the staff did a great job accommodating some requests I had to cut cake and champagne. The french toast was also delicious!
Highlights were the snails, monkfish with mushroom quinoa risotto, and the lava cake for dessert! Great place for birthdays
